class idpyoidc.message.oauth2.AuthorizationRequest(set_defaults=True, **kwargs)¶

Bases: idpyoidc.message.Message

An authorization request

c_param = {'client_id': (<class 'str'>, True, None, None, False), 'redirect_uri': (<class 'str'>, False, None, None, False), 'response_type': ([<class 'str'>], True, <function sp_sep_list_serializer>, <function sp_sep_list_deserializer>, False), 'scope': ([<class 'str'>], False, <function sp_sep_list_serializer>, <function sp_sep_list_deserializer>, False), 'state': (<class 'str'>, False, None, None, False)}¶
merge(request_object, treatement='strict', whitelist=None)¶

How to combine parameter that appear in the request with parameters that appear in the request object.

Parameters

  • request – The original request

  • request_object – The result of parsing the request/request_uri parameter

  • treatement – How to do the merge strict/lax/whitelist

  • whitelist – If whitelisted parameters from the request should be included in the result, this is the list to use.

class idpyoidc.message.oauth2.AuthorizationResponse(set_defaults=True, **kwargs)¶

Bases: idpyoidc.message.oauth2.ResponseMessage

An authorization response. If client_id is returned in the response it will be checked against a client_id value provided when calling the verify method. The same with iss (issuer).

c_param = {'client_id': (<class 'str'>, False, None, None, False), 'code': (<class 'str'>, True, None, None, False), 'error': (<class 'str'>, False, None, None, False), 'error_description': (<class 'str'>, False, None, None, False), 'error_uri': (<class 'str'>, False, None, None, False), 'iss': (<class 'str'>, False, None, None, False), 'state': (<class 'str'>, False, None, None, False)}¶
verify(**kwargs)¶

Make sure all the required values are there and that the values are of the correct type

idpyoidc.message.oauth2.factory(msgtype, **kwargs)¶

Factory method that can be used to easily instansiate a class instance

Parameters

  • msgtype – The name of the class

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments

Returns

An instance of the class or None if the name doesn’t match any known class.
